prop.head.headtext: Remedies for Breach of Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: The court may refuse a motion for an interlocutory injunction where the defendant undertakes to keep a full and proper accounting of receipts and to pay a specified portion of them into court or into a joint account. In so doing, the moving party's damages would be quantified and the funds would be available to satisfy any future award of damages.[1]
Warren v. Mendy, [1989] 1 W.L.R. 853 (C.A.), at p. 868; Cansafe Inc. v. Donkin, 2011 CarswellAlta 2021, 2011 ABQB 698.
